recipe.name: Vietnamese Pork Chop
recipe.description: Pork is probably the most widely used meat in Vietnam. This lemongrass marinade is perfect for a pork cutlet to cook on the outdoor grill.
recipeIngredient: 1 tbsp vegetable or peanut oil ((for cooking))
1 tsp chilli sauce ((sriracha, chilli paste) or 1 birds eye chilli, finely chopped)
1  stalk lemongrass (, white part only, bruised them sliced into 1cm/0.5" pieces)

recipeInstructions.text: Place the Marinade ingredients in a ziplock bag and massage the bag to mix the ingredients.
recipeInstructions.name: Place the Marinade ingredients in a ziplock bag and massage the bag to mix the ingredients.

recipeInstructions.text: Add pork to the Marinade and massage the bag to coat all the cutlets with the Marinade.
recipeInstructions.name: Add pork to the Marinade and massage the bag to coat all the cutlets with the Marinade.

recipeInstructions.text: Marinate for at least 4 hours, up to 24 hours.
recipeInstructions.name: Marinate for at least 4 hours, up to 24 hours.

recipeInstructions.text: Brush the outdoor grill with oil and heat to medium high (or pan on a stove).
recipeInstructions.name: Brush the outdoor grill with oil and heat to medium high (or pan on a stove).

recipeInstructions.text: Place pork on the grill and cook each side for 2 minutes, or until cooked (depends on thickness of the cutlets). Remember that it will continue to cook while resting.
recipeInstructions.name: Place pork on the grill and cook each side for 2 minutes, or until cooked (depends on thickness of the cutlets). Remember that it will continue to cook while resting.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove pork from the grill onto a plate and cover loosely with foil. Rest for 5 minutes before serving.

review.reviewBody: SIMPLY THE BEST FLAVOR I HAVE EVER TASTED IN PORK

These were the most delicious pork chops we’ve ever eaten. We bought 3 giant cutlets from our butcher, marinated for 6 hours and as soon as they hit the bbq the smell was so unreal- we knew it was a winner. Our whole neighbourhood must have been so jealous. This recipe is so simple, yet so bloody delicious. 6/5 stars!

The kitchen smelt absolutely amazing whilst the pork was in the grill. Tasted delish with a fresh green salad.May become one of the family favourites from one of the many favourite from recipe tin eats♥️
Delicious chop, loved the charred bits. This recipe is a keeper, Thanks Nagi

The pork chops turned out good. I was hoping for a more authentically VNese flavor.  Maybe my lime was on the bigger side?  The meat turned out a bit tart.  A note on a tablespoon-equivalent for the lime would probably help round out the taste of the marinade more accurately.
Best ever bbq’d pork chops we had. It was tasty and juicy.
Great tip about prepreparing the marinade and meat and freezing, I am always looking for tips to prepare ahead, when we entertain I want to also enjoy the day so these tips are appreciated
Thanks for the tip about prepreparing the marinade and meat and freezing, I am always looking for tips to prepare ahead, when we entertain I want to also enjoy the day so these tips are appreciated

Thank you Nagi. Absolutely delicious, was a big hit for the whole family and guests. I dont have lime so i replace with some redwine viniger still taste so good and tender. Will cook again for next party.
